Key Match Events: The Guardians evened the series with a tense, come-from-behind, 5-4 victory at Comerica Park.
Game 5 was moved up to 1 p.m. ET due to the threat of inclement weather.
Tarik Skubal has a 24-inning scoreless streak dating back to the regular season.
David Fry hit the go-ahead two-run homer in the seventh inning of Game 4.
Pre-Game Insights: Game 5 is expected to feature a rematch between Matthew Boyd and Tarik Skubal.
Skubal has not allowed a run in either of his two outings in his first postseason.
Boyd held the Tigers scoreless over 4 2/3 innings on Monday.
Teams that have won Game 4 when trailing 2-1 have then won Game 5 and the series 27 of 48 times (56%).
Teams are only 62-66 all-time in the postseason when playing a winner-take-all game in their home ballpark.
The Guardians and Tigers split the first four games of this round at the other’s ballpark.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch expressed the significance of the elimination game.
Guardians catcher Austin Hedges commented on the excitement and exhaustion of the postseason.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The winner will advance to face the Yankees in the ALCS beginning Monday night in the Bronx.
Kerry Carpenter was not in the starting lineup for Game 5 due to a left hamstring injury.
Tyler Freeman was replaced on the roster by Angel Martinez due to a strained left oblique.
